Package frc.util.motionprofile

Class PathGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.util.motionprofile.PathGenerator
  • public class PathGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    PathGenerator

    Generates a motion-profiled pure pursuit path given a path and some robot parameters. The path is a 2-dimensional array (n rows by 2 columns), with each point having an x and y coordinate. UNITS ARE IN INCHES.
    Since:
    2019-03-10

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathGenerator

        public PathGenerator​(double[][] path,
                     double pathMaxVel,
                     double accel,
                     double lookaheadRadius)
        The constructor for a PathGenerator object. UNITS ARE IN INCHES.
        Parameters:
        path - The path, in (x, y)-coordinates relative to the robot's starting position.
        pathMaxVel - The maxmimum theoretical velocity the path can be.
        accel - The acceleration of the robot.
        lookaheadRadius - The radius for the lookahead point. Usually a value from 12-25 inches.

    • Method Detail

      • inject

        public double[][] inject​(double spacing)
        Point injector. It injects evenly spaced points along a given path.
        Returns:
        This is the path used in the smoother.

      • smoother

        public double[][] smoother​(double[][] path,
                           double weight_data,
                           double weight_smooth,
                           double tolerance)
        This method is by Team FRC 2168. Optimization algorithm, which optimizes the data points in path to create a smooth trajectory. This optimization uses gradient descent. While unlikely, it is possible for this algorithm to never converge. If this happens, try increasing the tolerance level. BigO: N^x, where X is the number of of times the while loop iterates before tolerance is met.
        Parameters:
        path - The path.
        weight_data - A value, usually between 0.8 and 0.99.
        weight_smooth - 1 - weight_data.
        tolerance - This is 0.001, but change as you wish.
        Returns:
        A smoothed path.

        public static double[][] doubleArrayCopy​(double[][] arr)

      • closestPoint

        public int closestPoint()
        Gives the closest path point to the robot.
        Parameters:
        robotPos - The current robot position, in the form of a 2 row by 1 column array (x, y).
        Returns:
        The index of the closest path point.

      • lookaheadPoint

        public double[][] lookaheadPoint()
        Gets you the lookahead point.
        Returns:
        A 2*2 array, with the first row having the x and y coordinates and the second having the fractional index and the index.

      • lookaheadCurvature

        public double lookaheadCurvature()
        Calculates the curvature of the lookahead point.
        Returns:
        If the value is positive, the lookahead point is on the right; it's on the left if otherwise.

      • velocity

        public double velocity​(double trackWidth,
                       boolean left)
        Returns velocities.
        Parameters:
        trackWidth - The distance between the left and right wheels.
        robotPos -
        Returns:
        The first array entry is the left; the second is the right.
